title: Refactor OpenADRVENAgent

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
# Description

* Upgrades openleadr library to latest to ensure that cryptography does not get downgraded in Volttron. See related PR at https://github.com/OpenLEADR/openleadr-python/pull/129
~~* NOTE: the requirement for openleadr 0.5.27 will force the Volttron platform to upgrade from cryptography 37.0.4 to 38.0.4~~ By explicitly adding Volttron's cryptography requirement  to OpenADRVEN's requirements.py, we prevent the library openleadr from upgrading or downgrading requirements.py whenever the agent is installed. 
* Refactors OpenADRAgent to use Adapter pattern to create a separation between the VolttronOpenADRVenClient and the OpenLeadr client
* Fixes bug in config parsing method
* Updates test
* Reformats code to PEP8 compliance 


## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

# How Has This Been Tested?

I manually created an agent against the IPKeys test VTN.

title: Cannot open web admin page in VOLTTRON 7.x
body:
### Description of Issue
User cannot open admin page using https://<hostname>:8443/index.html. This is because incompatible version of pyJWT is pulled down during the bootstrap process. pyJWT should be pinned to 1.7.1 and correct version needs to be pulled down during bootstrap process.

### Affected Version
releases/7.x

title: bootstrap with --web is required for VOLTTRON 7.x
body: bootstrap with --web is required for VOLTTRON 7.x to startup.

title: VOLTTRON 7.x bootstrap fails because of greenlet and idna version mismatch.
body:
### Description of Issue
VOLTTRON 7.x bootstrap fails because of greenlet and idna version mismatch

### Affected Version
VOLTTRON 7.x

### Additional Details
This happens because greenlet and idna were downloaded automatically by requests package as depenedcies. requests package is pinned to specific version but latest version of greenlet and idna are not compatible with pinned version of requests package

title: removing an agent with `vctl remove` fails on platform using RMQ
body:
### Description of Issue
Using vctl to remove an agent fails with `'HTTPError'`

### Affected Version
7.x

### Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new platform using RMQ as message bus
* Install an agent (I've seen this with listener and with master driver)
* `vctl remove <uuid>` to remove the above agent
```
$ vctl remove c
Removing cee1b1da-493a-4815-a1ec-a620a3ccb29c master_driveragent-4.0
remove: error: 'HTTPError' object has no attribute 'message'
```

### Other notes
I've seen this on RPi and on an x86 VM. Using ZMQ on the same systems, removing agents works as expected.

title: Unhandled exceptions in historians cause process loop to exit but health remains good
body:
### Description of Issue

When an unhandled exception occurs in a historian implementation, it causes the process loop in the base historian (base_historian.py:BaseHistorianAgent._process_loop()) to exit so that the historian is not storing data, neither is it being written to the backup database, causing data to be lost. Running `vctl status`, however, shows that the agent is in good health, which is very misleading.

I ran into this issue when a temporary network failure caused a DNS lookup to fail on connect.

### Affected Version

All (AFAICT)

#### Expected

When the process loop exits unexpectedly (due to an unhandled exception), the agent health should indicate that there is a problem.

#### Actual

The agent remains in good health even though it is not.

### Steps to Reproduce

The easiest method to reproduce the error is to raise an exception from basedb.py:DbDriver.cursor():

```diff
diff --git a/volttron/platform/dbutils/basedb.py b/volttron/platform/dbutils/basedb.py
index ed7fb05d..96690ff5 100644
--- a/volttron/platform/dbutils/basedb.py
+++ b/volttron/platform/dbutils/basedb.py
@@ -101,6 +101,7 @@ class DbDriver(object):
                                "a cursor and is being ignored")
         self.__connection = None
         try:
+            raise ConnectionError('Houston, we have a problem')
             self.__connection = self.__connect()
         except Exception as e:
             _log.error("Could not connect to database. Raise ConnectionError")
```

### Additional Details

title: VirtualEnv URL change breaks bootstrap process
body: VirtualEnv URL has changed again breaking the bootstrap process. This has happened before #600. Fork their repo or find some other solution to prevent this changing out from underneath us again.

title: Platform crashes if instance name not found
body:
If the instance name for a platform in a discovery file does not match the name in that platforms config file, the platform with the bad discovery file crashes on line 156 of routingservice.py due to KeyError.

Steps to replicate:

Platform1 has external_platform_discovery.json file with entry:

"platform2": {"vip-address":"tcp://127.0.0.2:22916",
                  "instance-name":"platform2",
                  "serverkey":"<KEY>"}

but platform2 has the following config:                                    

[volttron]
vip-address = tcp://127.0.0.2:22916
instance-name = "myplatform"

You may need to restart the platforms after making the changes to see this error.

title: In some previous versions of develop, DataPuller can kill the router
body:
If DataPuller at commit: e6ff78b56f4b924a4f1d8100bf978a96f33de603,  attempts to connect to VOLTTRON 5.0, it causes the 5.0 router to crash due to going down an unexpected code path.

Short term: catch the key error to eliminate the crash.
Long term: identify the problem and if it is wider than that commit.

  raise KeyError(\'No configuration file "{}" for VIP IDENTIY {}\'.format(config_name, identity))
  KeyError: \'No configuration file "config" for VIP IDENTIY forwarder2\'\n')
`````

title: Latest version of pytest encounters recursion error
body: Pin version of py.test to 3.1.1

title: BACPypes > 13.8 causes errors
body: BACPypes required version was changed in develop and the scanner code (at least) is not compatible with this.

title: Install script can cause confusing errors when force is used without identity
body: If force option is used without a specified identity, you can run into errors on service agents such as VCP. Change script to require an identity when force is used.

title: modbus driver sends only one word of float point value.
body:
* I am testing volttron 4.0.1 platform. It's really nice. Thanks for your effort.
 But I found some matter to ask.

1)  I tried to write a float value (0xABCD) to modbus device using volttron modbus driver.
 In test.csv, the float point was set to '>f' register type.
 I found this driver always send on a word (0xAB).
ps. 0xABCD means two words. (4bytes)
     0xAB means one word. (2bytes)
 So, I worked around this matter like bellows.
actual float value is 0xABCD then converts it bellow two value then send it to two different point.
unsigned int value = 0xAB   ---> modbus word point 0
unsigned int value =0xCD   ----> modbus word point 1
But it isn't a best way i think.

I'm very curious , when I read input register using '>f" type it read a float value(0xABCD) , correctly. but write doesn't work.

Can I send float value to directly to modbus float point?


2) reading float value '>f' works well because most of modbus devices support big endian type mod bus address, but some devices use different way, like bellows
actual value = 0xABCD
point address 0 : 0xCD
point address 1: 0xAB
In this case '<f'  means 0xBADC(!wrong)  Are there any way to solve this matter?

Thanks..

title: No recovery from database connection failure
body: I had to migrate my mongodb yesterday, and things went a little south, leaving me with a mongo outage of several hours. Once mongo was restored, I was able to see data from existing charts in VC, and assumed all was working. When I looked at it the next morning, all of the data was stale, and on further examination, the VC instance was out of memory. (4GB) Restarting the mongo historian did not resolve the issue and only a full platform restart brought connectivity back, but it of course also lost the data in memory.

title: Unable to use ipv6 addresses
body: socket.py is missing an import for re which causes it to fail when trying to use an ipv6 address.

title: Add a timeout wrapper around DataMove RPC call
body:
Add:

with gevent.Timeout(30):
 
Just like in ForwardHistorian for handling a timeout correctly

title: 4.0 documentation version still at 3.5RC1
Agent utils for get time in seconds from epoch doesn't update
body: It returns the same value after the first time it is called.

title: VC Web interface crashes when platform agent has communications error.
body:
When a platform has an issue with communications for its platform.agent, the web ui crashes completely and must be killed in Chrome 54.0.2840.99 on Windows 

More specifically, if you click the arrow to expand the list of agents on that platform in the left sidebar, a jsonrpc call is made with no response, leading to the UI hanging and eventually crashing.

This could be as general as any jsonrpc call timing out causes the interface to crash. With the console open, the last message that is displayed before becoming unresponsive is "Wating for response...."

title: Can only scan one device for points in VC
body: In device configuration, you can get the points off one device, but then if you try to get points off another device, the attempt hangs and the spinner spins indefinitely.

title: SQLHistorian has no writer attribute
body:
This happens sometimes during agent start up.  My guess is there is a race condition between the writer and reader.

I believe that the process loop in the base historian gets backed up data and attempts to write to the writer before the agents writer is fully initialized.

```
2016-10-26 15:44:11,091 (sqlhistorianagent-3.6.0 1179) <stderr> ERROR: Exception in thread Thread-2:
2016-10-26 15:44:11,091 (sqlhistorianagent-3.6.0 1179) <stderr> ERROR: Traceback (most recent call last):

title: BaseHistorian is adding all to topics
body:
The base  historian at line 518 will always add an "all" to the end of topics. This was to deal with #618 but will result in device/all/all and then strip off the last all but then in capture data add points to the end. Result will be device/all/point. Refactor this. The desired outcome is to add the values in the dictionary to the end of the topic sent in.

```
    if not topic.endswith('/'):
        topic += '/'

    if not topic.endswith('all'):
        topic += 'all'

    parts = topic.split('/')
    # strip off the first part of the topic.
    device = '/'.join(parts[1:-1])
```

title: MODBUS driver tries to get points that don't exist.
body:
The MODBUS driver tries to use the read range functionality of pymodbus everywhere it can. On some devices there are gaps in the registers. Those devices are terrible and should feel bad. (Just kidding!) If we try to read across one of those gaps it fails and the device fails to scrape.

We need to break up the range reads to skip any potential gaps.

title: Handle forwarder not running when try to add chart
body: For a remote platform, if you try to add a chart in VC, the chart can't be added if the forwarder isn't running. The status message you get says "Unable to load chart: the historian agent is not available." That would make sense for the local instance, but for remote instances, the message should be that the forwarder isn't available.

title: Slowness of adding charts can mess up state
body:
When clicking a checkbox to add a chart, if the UI is slow from collecting data from remote platforms, you can uncheck the box right after the chart appears, and the chart will go away but then come back again. This is shown in the image below, where the chart is present but the checkbox isn't checked.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15679599/15938335/9b1ef05e-2e27-11e6-93c8-87530a4a709c.png)

It likely is happening because when a chart is added, the timer for refreshing the chart is started. Normally, when you uncheck the checkbox to remove the chart, that timer is stopped. But because of the slowness of adding the chart, you can remove the chart faster than the timer can be started and stopped again. So the timer still refreshes the chart, and the chart gets added back to the UI.

title: Need a scrollbar for the Platforms screen
body: Platform tab has no scrollbar which is a problem if there are a large number of agents

title: Platforms losing registration when PlatformAgent is restarted
body: VOLTTRON Platforms should not require re-registration when their platform agent is restarted.

title: virtualenv url for latest version breaks convention and cause bootstrapping to fail
body:
The format for the source download url has changed from the format in: https://virtualenv.pypa.io/en/stable/installation/

https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/v/virtualenv/virtualenv-X.X.tar.gz

In 15.0.2 it is:

https://pypi.python.org/packages/5c/79/5dae7494b9f5ed061cff9a8ab8d6e1f02db352f3facf907d9eb614fb80e9/virtualenv-15.0.2.tar.gz

Unless they quickly change back to the old convention, all releases must be hotfixed.

In bootstrap.py the following line:

url = ('https://pypi.python.org/packages/source/v/virtualenv/'
                   'virtualenv-{}.tar.gz'.format(self.version))

Should be changed to:
url = ('https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/archive/'
                   '{}.tar.gz'.format(self.version))

title: Actuator does not handle requests from different timezones
body:
MachineA is using PST timezone
MachineB is using UTC

Agent on MachineA schedules a device on MachineB.

Actuator does not handle the difference in timezones.

We should probably assume that naïve submitted timestamps are local. We also need to use aware timestamps internally and that should fix it. Convert everything to UTC.

title: Change version requirements for requests
body:
2.7 does not include NewConnectionError. Change requirements.txt to pin to minimum of 2.10

from requests.packages.urllib3.connection import NewConnectionError

title: Remove saved charts when a platform is deregistered
body: When a platform is deregistered in vc, its saved charts need to be cleared out. Otherwise, vc will try to load the charts even though the platform isn't in the UI anymore.

title: VC should work correctly whether the local platform is registered or not
body: In vc, the local instance isn't registered. This causes a problem where when you check a point in the tree to graph it, the tree and Charts area reload.

title: Sometimes agent list is empty after registering a new platform
body: In the platform manager area of VC's UI, sometimes when you register a platform, the agents list comes back empty, even if it has agents. It seems to be a timing issue. After the register_instance method returns a response, list_agents is called for that platform. If you put breakpoints in the debugger to slow everything down, the agents list will have the correct agents in it. But if you instead use console.logs to show the values without stopping, you can see that the agent list comes back with a count of zero.

title: Chart parse error if value for a point is "infinity"
body: Point type is integer but the driver is reading "infinity". Charts need to handle this better than returning a parse error.

title: Points are added to charts slowly, can mess up state
body:
In VC, it can take a while between checking a box to add a device point and the time when the graph appears. This allows the user to uncheck the box before the chart appears. So then you have a chart for a point, but no check next to the item in the tree.

We probably should add some kind of throttling mechanism to the UI the way we do for expanding platforms. Probably simplest would be to disable/enable the checkbox until the chart loading completes. Or could hide the checkbox and show a spinny circle.

title: Page often reloads when submitting modal forms
body:
This is why sometimes when you try to register a platform nothing happens, not even a status indicator. Instead of the rpc call to register_instance, the app reloads.

It also was related to the page reloading issue when adding and removing charts. When deleting a chart, if asked to confirm, the page would often reload. That's why the confirm-chart-removal dialog was removed as part of task #536.

title: VC statuses should be more helpful
body: In the tree, the BUILDING 8+9 instance doesn't seem responsive. Clicking on it doesn't expand the node. In the platform manager, its agents don't load. Yet in the tree, it has a healthy status with the message "All devices are publishing normally." Instead, the status should be unknown or bad, to indicate there's a problem getting agents. And the message should report the problem.

title: Some points don't show up in charts
body: When you check device points such as ZoneTemperature (RM109), the chart title and buttons appear, but there's no chart -- no axes, no line, etc.

title: Chart tooltips sometimes are hard to get rid of
body: Sometimes a chart tooltip won't go away like it's supposed to if the mouse moves out of frame before the tooltip is told to hide. When this happens in combination with multiple charts and scrolling around on the page, you can't even tell which chart the tooltip belongs to so you can go back to that chart and re-hover over it and get the tooltip to go away.

title: Saving and getting charts fails with empty lists
body: set_setting should work for {"key": "charts", "value": ""} but does not. Likewise, get_setting should not return an error when the value for a key is "" or the key isn't found.

title: Routing issues with Charts may prevent displaying a new chart when it's added
body:
Happens the first time a chart is added. Not sure exact steps to reproduce, but has to do with whether the route has gone to Charts yet, has gone away from Charts yet, or whether the tree panel has been extended yet. And it's either when the first chart is added through the tree or whether it's first added through the Add Charts dialog. 

Whatever the case, adding the first chart causes the Charts route to reload and no chart is added. Then if you repeat the steps to add the chart, the chart is added.

(Not sure of the exact scenario to reproduce it because when the issue was worse, it tended to happen from any of these circumstances. Since then, the issue has been improved (i.e., mostly fixed). But this task is being added because it still may happen occasionally and should be fixed.)

title: Double-clicking tree node might duplicate children
body: When expanding tree for first time, double-clicking on instance node might cause devices under it to be listed twice. It seems to do with the timing delay caused by not expanding the tree until all the data is retrieved. The second click seems to call the service again, so all the data is eventually returned twice.

fix issues with tests forwarder with tests that fail due to config property change
Add longer timeout period for VC <-> VC Platform connections.

title: Unmanage doesn't properly unmanage an external platform
body: After a vcplatform has been registered with vc if you unregister the external platform from vc then the platform is unable to be re-registered with the same vc.

title: VCPlatform agent or VC needs to be aware of anonymization
body: Currently we have code that will transform topics from internal to external topics through the base historian.  This needs to be exposed to vc so that the querying of the central historian can be completed.

title: Starting historian before platform breaks communication
body: This was observed in Volttron Central, in the vc-demo branch. When checking a data topic, the query fails if the historian agent is started before the platform agent. It shouldn't matter the order -- the historian should be able to recover after the platform agent starts.

title: BaseHistorian is truncating analysis topic paths
body:
The way analysis is handled is modeled on devices. However, devices listens for the "all" publish while analysis listens to individual points. 

However, analysis is still trying to truncate the "all" from the topic. 

Quick fix is to stop truncating. Further discussion could be made to decide if analysis should just function from "all" and be exactly like devices.

title: Changes to auth.json not automatically picked up by platform
body: Manual changes to auth.json are no longer automatically picked up by the platform. Is this by design?

title: pack_install.sh can fail due to newline in wheel name

title: Chart data not loading in VC
Device driver failure when MasterDriver is started too soon after proxy.
body: If a device driver is started immediately after the BACnetProxy (say sequentially on one volttron-ctl start command) then device drivers may fail to hookup correctly and launch.

title: actuator should not access array agent id to schedule new task
body:
Actuator should fail to schedule a task when the agent id is an array as it cannot be used as key in dictionary. If no error is thrown during the request_schedule process, the next schedule request with a conflict will fail with "unhashable type: list " error instead of CONFLICTS_WITH_EXISTING_SCHEDULES. 
Please see test method  test_schedule_error_intarray_agentid  in test_actuator_pubsub.py and test_actuator_rpc.py.  Please remove the decorator pytest.mark.xfail to test

title: Unable to query sqlhistorian for a specific timestamp or only with start or stop
body:
Unable to query sqlhistorian connected to sqlite3 for a specific time.
- [ ]  There is no explicit way to query for a specific time so I queried by setting the start and stop time to the same value. I expected this to run a query of the format 

`SELECT * FROM data where ts between  "2015-12-17 22:46:59.203117+00:00" and  "2015-12-17 22:46:59.203117+00:00"  and topic_id =2;`
or 
`SELECT * FROM data where ts >=  "2015-12-17 22:46:59.203117+00:00" and  ts<="2015-12-17 22:46:59.203117+00:00"  and topic_id =2;`

the above queries does not work without the "+00:00" at the end
- [ ]  Similarly when only start or stop time is specified it would be good to include the specified value. This could serve as another way to query for a specific value. This query would work with or without the timezone at the end. 
  `SELECT * FROM data where ts >="2015-12-17 22:46:59.203117+00:00"`
  or
  `SELECT * FROM data where ts >="2015-12-17 22:46:59.203117"`

title: Logging exceptions in agents causes JSON serialization error

The _JSONFormatter_ logging formatter installed by _volttron.platform.agent.utils:setup_logging_ serialized logger output as JSON to be passed via stderr to the platform for appending to the actual VOLTTRON log. However, _Exception_ objects are not serializeable as JSON and an exception is raised. Here is an example of the error from the log file:

title: Problem with getting VCentral's external addresses
body: Query service is failing because it expects a list and gets a string.

title: Importing base_historian has side effects
body: Importing base_historian causes several things to happen at the module level which produces unexpected console output or other undesirable actions. The lex and yacc calls could be moved to a class constructor and called when an instance of the class is first created rather than when the module is loaded.

title: driven and base_historian modules should not be loaded by package
body:
Rather than be loaded when importing volttron.platform.agent, the driven and base_historian modules should only be loaded when they are required by explicitly importing volttron.platform.agent.driven or volttron.platform.agent.base_historian. Only the base agent classes from .base were intended to become part of the agent module.

Agents exist which try the driven and base_historian agent classes from volttron.platform.agent. They will need to be updated with the __init__ module to avoid breakage.

title: New pubsub subsystem may break compatibility with 2.x agents
body: The new pubsub subsystem is implemented over the RPC subsystem. As a consequence, the header and message is automatically serialized as JSON when sent and automatically deserialized at the remote end, so explicit serialization is not required as long as the values can be converted to valid JSON. 2.x agents, however, expect to send ZeroMQ frames and must explicitly serialize and deserialize messages. So new agents must also be explicit when communicating in a mixed environment or 2.x agents might not be able to interpret their messages.

title: PassiveAFDD in 2.x crashes
body: Current config file does not support new version of the code.

title: Volttron central needs to notice when a platform comes back online and re-manage it.
body: The vc agent can monitor /platform on the platform's address to determine the availability.

title: Global options to volttron-ctl not honored
body: Calling `volttron-ctl --vip-address /tmp/vip.socket status` is not the same as calling `volttron-ctl status --vip-address /tmp/vip.socket`. The latter works as expected while the former ignores the --vip-address option, not even displaying an error. These two commands should be identical.

title: If platform is not available from a previously registered platform then show as failure
body: Currently what happens is the platform is shown, but loading agents doesn't complete successfully.  We should either just show no agents are listed or designate that there was an issue connecting to this platform for some reason.

title: Can't change vc port through config file.
Need to refresh 2x to get back to login
body:
If on a page other than the #/login and restart the volttron server, refreshing will show the login page without any username or password box.

Refreshing once again will show both username and password boxes.  I imagine there is a state confilict here.

Note this is not a huge issue.

title: Error interpreting timestamps with sqlite3 in Python 2.7.3
body:
The sqlite3 version in Python 2.7.3 cannot deal with timestamps containing a timezone. It tries to interpret the microseconds with the tz still attached which cannot be converted to an int.

Basically, in dbapi2.py it's doing this:
microseconds = int("558982+00:00")

When it should do this (as it does in Python 2.7.6):
microseconds = int('{:0<6.6}'.format("558982+00:00".decode()))

Correct code is:
microseconds = int('{:0<6.6}'.format(timepart_full[1].decode()))

We need to find a way to update the sqlite3 version for older Python versions. One possible solution is: 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14541869/how-to-upgrade-sqlite3-in-python-2-7-3-inside-a-virtualenv

title: Uploading agent produces silent results
body: The agent is uploaded fine (assuming it is a valid whl file), however there is not a good response from the webserver due to the streaming nature.  The stream is closed before the code has a chance to finish returning from the rpc call.

title: SMAPHistorian not working with private streams
body: Need to add ?key=<key> to the urls for accessing private streams

title: Agent isn't removed when removing running agent
body:
When an agent is runing (has a pid in status window) if the user removes the agent via volttron-ctl remove uuid...the agent still shows in the volttron-ctl status as being a running process.  

Trying to stop the agent at this point produces an error not found (i.e. volttron-ctl stop uuid).  volttron-ctrl clear does not remove the agent from volttron-ctl status list.

Restarting volttron does remove the agent from the volttron-ctl status list.

title: Platforms do not re-register if VOLTTRON Central restarts
body:
If VOLTTRON Central is restarted after a platform has registered, this registration is lost.

VC should store registration information in order to resume state. Alternatively/additionally, platforms could periodically re-register with VC.
